    Upgrading from 151 to 154

    If you are asking for help, provide lots of detail so problems can be reproduced.

    Things to describe:
    operating system - UNIX
    version of ATutor - 1.5.1 to 1.5.4
    versions of php -
    version of mysq l -
    webserver & version -
    copies of error messages -

    Error
    Table AT_groups alteration failed.
    Table AT_groups alteration failed.
    Table AT_modules alteration failed.
    Table AT_courses alteration failed.
    Table AT_courses alteration failed.
    Table AT_members alteration failed.
    Table AT_members alteration failed.
    Table AT_resource_categories alteration failed.
    Table AT_links_categories alteration failed.
    Table AT_links_categories alteration failed.
    Table AT_resource_links alteration failed.
    Table AT_links alteration failed.
    Table AT_handbook_notes alteration failed.
    Table AT_tests_questions alteration failed.
    Table AT_tests alteration failed.
    Table AT_members alteration failed.
    Table AT_forums alteration failed.
    Table AT_content alteration failed.


    changes to default settings -
    web browser being used -
    and anything else relevant -

    Hi

    I have serious problems with upgrading ATutor V 1.5.1 to V 1.5.4!
    As i wantet to upgrade it stoped by messages about Permission proplems of source /content/several files and directories to include/lib/filemanager.inc.php at linr 36 ore 39 (sorry I can not say exatly because as I restartet the installation the database can not delete the taps above)

    So I have two problems:
    1st the upgrade stops at the Erreors of the already deleted Database tabs and I can not go ahead!
    2nd The permissions are not possible to change by FTP with chmode

    So I have a ATutor not running at all!


  • 2007-07-03 08:40:36

    Re: Upgrading from 1.5.1 to 1.5.4

    You should restore the backups you took prior to upgrading. Make sure that mysql user has create tables permissions. Then try again.

  • 2007-07-04 08:37:35

    Re: Upgrading from 1.5.1 to 1.5.4

    Try upgrading using a different browser.

    Have a look at the tail of the webserver error log after an error occurs to see if there is any information there about what the problem might be.

    Also, did you wait long enough at step 5. It can take a long time to update if you have many courses, or a lot of content in your courses.

  • 2007-07-09 09:14:16

    Re: Upgrading from 1.5.1 to 1.5.4

    I just tried a 1.5.1 to 1.5.4 and didn't experience any trouble in the installation. Though there was a problem creating the feeds directory, which was easily fixed by manually creating it.

    I'd suggest trying to upgrade in two or three steps. from 1.5.1 to 1.5.3, then to 1.5.4.

    As for copying and deleting directories, because the content directory is owned by the webserver, your shell account user can't perform these functions. Your shell account can move the content directory (mv)
